  • Proverbs 31
1 Hear, ye children, the instruction of a mother, and attend to know understanding. 2 For I give you good doctrine; forsake ye not my teaching. 3 For I was a daughter unto my mother, tender and an only one in the sight of my father. 4 And she taught me, and said unto me: 'Let thy heart hold fast my words, keep my commandments, and live; 5 Get wisdom, get understanding; forget not, neither decline from the words of my mouth; 6 Forsake him not, and he will preserve thee; love him, and he will keep thee. 7 The beginning of wisdom is: Get wisdom; yea, with all thy getting get understanding. 8 Extol him, and he will exalt thee; he will bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace him. 9 He will give to thy head a chaplet of grace; a crown of glory will he bestow on thee.' 10 Hear, O my daughter, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many. 11 I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in paths of uprightness. 12 When thou goest, thy step shall not be straitened; and if thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble. 13 Take fast hold of instruction, let him not go; keep him, for he is thy life.
14 Enter not into the path of the wicked, and walk not in the way of evil women. 15 Avoid it, pass not by it; turn from it, and pass on. 16 For they sleep not, except they have done evil; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall. 17 For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence. 18 But the path of the righteous is as the light of dawn, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day. 19 The way of the wicked is as darkness; they know not at what they stumble.

 20 My daughter, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings. 21 Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thy heart. 22 For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh. 23 Above all that thou guardest keep thy heart; for out of it are the issues of life. 24 Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee. 25 Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee. 26 Make plain the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.
